trans-unit.source: Used to invoke the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page.UpdateModel``1(``0)"></xref> or <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page.TryUpdateModel``1(``0)"></xref> method when the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref> object is not directly accessible.

For example, a custom class can define the methods referred to by the `SelectMethod`, `UpdateMethod`, `DeleteMethod`, and `InsertMethod` properties for data binding, and those methods can have a parameter of this type and use it to invoke the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.UpdateModel%2A> method.

Alternatively, instead of a method parameter, the <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelMethodContext.Current%2A> property can be used within a method to invoke the <xref:System.Web.UI.Page.UpdateModel%2A> method.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelMethodContext"></xref> class.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
The page object.
The page parameter is `null`.

Gets the <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelMethodContext"></xref> object that corresponds to the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Page"></xref> object that is in the <xref href="System.Web.HttpContext.Current"></xref> property.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.ModelMethodContext"></xref> object., or `null` if the current request is not for a page.
Gets the model state.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
The model state.
Updates the specified model instance using values from a value provider.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
The model.
The type of the model.
`true` if model binding is successful; otherwise, `false`.
Updates the specified model instance using values from the specified value provider.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
The model.
The value provider.
The type of the model.
`true` if model binding is successful; otherwise, `false`.
Updates the specified model instance using values from a value provider.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
The model.
The type of the model.
Updates the specified model instance using values from the specified value provider.
For a tutorial series on using model binding with Web Forms, see [Model Binding and Web Forms](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=286117).
The model.
The value provider.
The type of the model.
